item.title: Bayesian inference
item.description: 1 Two approaches In frequentist inference, a parameter \(\theta\) is assumed as a fixed unknown quantity, however, in Bayesian inference, we assume a parameter \(\theta\) to be a random variable. For example, the coefficients in linear regression model, or unknown population parameters, are random variables. 2 Bayesâ€™ rule Let \(\theta\) represents proportation of people who are mutants in Atlanta. \(Y\) is the number of mutants from a random sample in Atlanta.
